docs.snippet: The suspended chief executive of Cambridge Analytica said in a secretly recorded video broadcast on Tuesday that his UK-based political consultancy's online campaign played a decisive role in U.S. President Donald Trump's 2016 election victory.

headline.print_headline: Cambridge Analytica CEO Claims Influence on U.S. Election, Facebook Questioned
headline.main: Cambridge Analytica CEO Claims Influence on U.S. Election, Facebook Questioned

docs.snippet: Sure. Take that quiz about which hair-metal band is your spirit animal. Share a few snaps of your toddler at the beach and watch the likes pile up. Comment on that pointed political opinion from the classmate you haven't seen since the Reagan admi...

headline.print_headline: Facebook: A Community Like No Other. Should You Leave It?
headline.main: Facebook: A Community Like No Other. Should You Leave It?

docs.snippet: The European Union is planning to apply tougher consumer laws to social media networks and email providers like Facebook and Google's Gmail as scrutiny of data protection grows in the wake of an outcry over Facebook's handling of data.

headline.print_headline: EU Plans Tougher Consumer Laws for Facebook, Gmail
headline.main: EU Plans Tougher Consumer Laws for Facebook, Gmail

docs.snippet: The psychologist at the centre of a scandal over the misuse of millions of Facebook users' personal data worked with Russian researchers on a study of toxic personality traits.

headline.print_headline: Academic in Facebook Storm Worked on Russian 'Dark' Personality Project
headline.main: Academic in Facebook Storm Worked on Russian 'Dark' Personality Project

docs.snippet: Facebook's latest privacy scandal, involving Trump campaign consultants who allegedly stole data on tens of millions of users in order to influence elections, has some people reconsidering their relationship status with the social network.

headline.print_headline: Breaking Up With Facebook? It's Harder Than It Looks
headline.main: Breaking Up With Facebook? It's Harder Than It Looks

docs.snippet: Germany on Tuesday voiced alarm at reports that a political consultancy hired by Donald Trump improperly accessed information on 50 million Facebook users, and lawmakers demanded answers from the company and the government.

headline.print_headline: Germany Alarmed by Facebook Data Abuse Reports, Lawmakers Demand Answers
headline.main: Germany Alarmed by Facebook Data Abuse Reports, Lawmakers Demand Answers

docs.snippet: Germany's second-largest bank, Commerzbank, has suspended advertising on Facebook until further notice, after a massive leak of user data, its head of brand strategy told the Handelsblatt business daily.

headline.print_headline: Commerzbank Suspends Ads on Facebook After Data Leak
headline.main: Commerzbank Suspends Ads on Facebook After Data Leak

docs.snippet: Germany's justice minister Katarina Barley has asked Facebook to clarify whether the personal data of the social media site's 30 million users in the country were protected from unlawful use by third parties, according to a report in the Funke gro...

headline.print_headline: Germany Summons Facebook Over User Data Safety Concerns: Report
headline.main: Germany Summons Facebook Over User Data Safety Concerns: Report

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc's shares fell more than 4 percent in premarket trading after media reports that a political consultancy that worked on President Donald Trump's campaign gained inappropriate access to data on 50 million Facebook users.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Shares Slide After Reports of Data Misuse
headline.main: Facebook Shares Slide After Reports of Data Misuse

docs.snippet: Facebook shares fell more than 6 percent in morning trading as the social media company faced criticism following reports that a data mining company working for the Trump campaign improperly obtained and kept data on tens of millions of users duri...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Shares Sink More Than 6 Percent on Privacy Issues
headline.main: Facebook Shares Sink More Than 6 Percent on Privacy Issues
